rule.name: NoLongScripts
rule.message: Avoid having long scripts (e.g. Javascript) inside a JSP file.
rule.description: Scripts should be part of Tag Libraries, rather than part of JSP pages.
rule.example:
<HTML>
<BODY>
<!--Java Script-->
<SCRIPT language="JavaScript" type="text/javascript">
<!--
function calcDays(){
  var date1 = document.getElementById('d1').lastChild.data;
  var date2 = document.getElementById('d2').lastChild.data;
  date1 = date1.split("-");
  date2 = date2.split("-");
  var sDate = new Date(date1[0]+"/"+date1[1]+"/"+date1[2]);
  var eDate = new Date(date2[0]+"/"+date2[1]+"/"+date2[2]);
  var daysApart = Math.abs(Math.round((sDate-eDate)/86400000));
  document.getElementById('diffDays').lastChild.data = daysApart;
}

onload=calcDays;
//-->
</SCRIPT>
</BODY>
</HTML>

rule.name: NoScriptlets
rule.message: Avoid having scriptlets inside a JSP file.
rule.description: Scriptlets should be factored into Tag Libraries or JSP declarations, rather than being part of JSP pages.

rule.name: NoInlineStyleInformation
rule.message: Avoid having style information in JSP files.
rule.description: Style information should be put in CSS files, not in JSPs. Therefore, don't use <B> or <FONT> tags, or attributes like "align='center'".

rule.name: NoClassAttribute
rule.message: Do not use an attribute called 'class'.
rule.description: Do not use an attribute called 'class'. Use "styleclass" for CSS styles.

rule.name: NoJspForward
rule.message: Do not do a forward from within a JSP file.
rule.description: Do not do a forward from within a JSP file.

rule.name: IframeMissingSrcAttribute
rule.message: IFrames must have a src attribute.
rule.description: IFrames which are missing a src element can cause security information popups in IE if you are accessing the page through SSL. See http://support.microsoft.com/default.aspx?scid=kb;EN-US;Q261188

rule.name: NoHtmlComments
rule.message: Use JSP comments instead of HTML comments
rule.description: In a production system, HTML comments increase the payload between the application server to the client, and serve little other purpose. Consider switching to JSP comments.
rule.example:
<HTML><title>bad example><BODY> <!-- HTML comment --> </BODY> </HTML>
<HTML><title>good example><BODY> <%-- JSP comment --%> </BODY> </HTML>

rule.name: DuplicateJspImports
rule.description: Avoid duplicate import statements inside JSP's.

rule.name: JspEncoding
rule.message: JSP file should use UTF-8 encoding
rule.description: A missing 'meta' tag or page directive will trigger this rule, as well as a non-UTF-8 charset.
rule.example:
Most browsers should be able to interpret the following headers:
<%@ page contentType="text/html; charset=UTF-8" pageEncoding="UTF-8" %>
